The staff was very courteous and helpful throughout my stay, even getting me a taxi within 10 minutes at 5am. Internet access is free. There are 2 small computers available for free use in the lobby (15 minute limit per session) & you can print your boarding passes. The concierge was always helpful. There is a restaurant & lounge on the premises. I did not try the restaurant but Seattle locals I talked to in my meetings said that it is very good. The lounge is good; the appetizers are big enough for a meal. The hotel is very centrally located. It is within 1 block of the Light Rail to the airport and the monorail to the Space Needle. It is only 3 blocks from the Pike Street market & within easy walking distance of lots of shopping & restaurants. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect location for all we wanted to do”
Reviews.Author: kanikani2
Reviews.Content: The service was great. The concierage helped us frequently with site seeing and travel plans. They were friendly and their advise was spot on. This hotel is in the perfect location. Tunnel buses and light rail can be caught accross the street by Macy's. There is a hall way entrance to the Westlake mall. There are several places to eat in the food court on the second floor of the Westlake Mall. There is a good variety of food at reasonable prices. I am grateful to the front desk for their helpfulness. We were supposed to arrive Sept 10th at 9:00 pm, but Amtrak was stalled by a broken down freight train blocking their path for 6 hours. Between that and other delays, we did not arrive till Sept 11th at 5:10 am. Bless the Mayflower, they let us checkout lake at 3:00 pm. When we returned to them on Sept 15-18th, we stayed in their mini-suite. We totally enjoyed the mini-suite. I will definately always stay at the Mayflower when I come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Frances N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days the last week of August. It was close to just about anyplace you would want to visit in downtown Seattle. I especially liked that you are able to get to the Westlake Center and also to the Monorail without even having to go outside. The staff were very nice and I only ate at the restaurant for one lunch and one dinner. The food was good. All in all, a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Foyelady
Reviews.Content: This hotel has charm galore and the location is great. Its across the street from a large Macy's Dept Store and a 5-10 minute walk to the Pike Place Public Market and a quirky restaurant called The Pink Door. Conveniently there is a large drug chain store across the street in the opposite direction. There's a lot of shopping in the area. The hotel staff is very helpful and pleasant. The hotel upgraded me to a junior suite which had a full bath & a 3/4 bath, 2 large closets, a living area and a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds. There were french doors between the living and bedroom areas and a flat screen TV in each area. The view looked out on the Space Needle & the lights of the city. The lobby is relaxed in an almost European style. This hotel is sort of old school, in a good way. The Mayflower Park was perfect for a woman travelling alone because it has human scale and a genteel quality. By the way, breakfast in Andaluca, their casual restaurant, was delicious and they put plenty on the plate!!

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leebird622
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located near boutiques, restaurants and Pike's Place. Rooms are small but workable. Only one night stand next to queen size bed, however. Staff was helpful and the hotel had a lovely sitting room up a small flight of stairs, opposite a very nice bar.

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to downtown Seattle hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaylacat
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of 6 (we all had our own rooms) for a one night stay. The location was unbeatable! Right in the middle of all the great downtown shopping (there is even a hallway that connects to Westlake Center), a quick walk to Pike's Place, and a GREAT bar and restuarant on site. My room actually had views of the Sound and Lake Union. We were all upgraded upon check in to Deluxe(?) rooms that had a sitting area and a sleeping area with 2 queen beds. All of the staff we encountered were awesome! very helpful and friendly! My room was spotless too... no complaints here! One of my travel companions noted a kind of musty smell as we stepped off the elevator, but I did not smell it in my room which was right off the elevator area. It is an older building, which is what gives the hotel its charm, but over all the place was kept up immaculately and very clean! I would most definitely stay here again as the rates were also very affordable for a downtown hotel (and they offer government rates!!).

Reviews.Title: “Comfy warm hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravellady
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Maayflower Park hotel. Service was very attentive and friendly. Location was great, close to everything that we wanted to see. The room was on the small side but comfortable. My only suggestion to make the room work better, each bedside should have a nightstand. Restaurant and bar on the premises were both very good. A close walk to Pikes Place market. Loved kolas for breakfast, a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay before cruises.”
Reviews.Author: davidski1
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights before our Alaskan cruise to be downtown and to explore Seattle. Hotel was great, a little on the pricey side, very close to seattle attractions. Staff was very helpful, friendly and went out of their way to direct us to the sights. very close to subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “For my next vacation, I just want to go stay at the Mayflower Park for a week!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park Hotel is beautiful, charming, and an absolutely wonderful place to stay. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, the rooms lovely and comfortable, and the hotel, overall, is elegant yet inviting. In planning our pre- and post-cruise stay in Seattle, my friend and I wanted to find a nice downtown location, and a unique hotel that would add to a great vacation experience. The Mayflower Park far exceeded those expectations, and our stay there was memorable in and of itself. The cruise package, which included transportation to and from the pier, as well as breakfast in the excellent Andaluca restaurant, was great. No worries, no stress - the staff took care of everything, and we had a great start to our travel days. I would also like to extend a special "thank you" to the manager at the registration desk for his kindness. When we returned from our cruise on Sunday morning, we were exhausted. Although it was still before check-out time (and long before check-in time), I asked him when our room might be ready, and he offered to call us as soon as it was available. Not 15 minutes later, we received the call AND we had been given an upgrade to a suite. It hardly needs to be said that we were treated very, very well at the Mayflower Park, and highly recommend this marvelous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our Anniversary stay at the Mayflower Park!”
Reviews.Author: jobuck50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed terrific service! Our room was lovely and the views of Seattle were wonderful. We loved that we could walk to the waterfront, shopping and Pikes Place Market from our hotel. We highly recommend the Mayflower Park and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: ukienomad
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one evening here after our cruise and it was lovely. The check in person was very friendly and helpful, the (deluxe) room was large and the linens were great - pillows, bedding, towels, etc. The room was very clean and decorated in a traditional style. The lobby area was lovely with chandeliers and fresh flowers. All the employees there were wonderful. They had a happy hour that had shrimp coconut, breaded shrimp, vegetables & dip....it was great. They kept our luggage the next day until we departed. They also have free internet service. The hotel was much classier than the one we stayed at before our cruise (the Warwick).....a little bit more money but it was worth it. We would definitely recommend this place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Service, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Teresa V
Reviews.Content: We were trying to decide which hotel to stay at. We found several in our price range, but couldn't decide so we went for a Travelocity Mystery hotel. The one we chose was well reviewed even though they don't tell you the name until after you book. We took a chance and ended up at the Mayflower Park Hotel. It was right in the middle of downtown, right where we wanted to be. We flew in and took the Light Rail from Sea Tac Airport and got off within a few blocks of the hotel. The Mayflower Park Hotel is older but beautifully redone in pretty original form. It was extremely clean and the staff made us feel like we were old friends visiting. We were invited to a wine tasting in the restaurant and were served in a first class manner. Our room was nicely decorated and had everything we needed. We were on the 11th floor with a great view of the downtown area. The bed was wonderful, didn't want to get up in the morning, but felt great when we did. We slept with the windows open so we could hear the sounds of the city. The room was very quiet with them closed. This will be our first choice for our next stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: haigogo
Reviews.Content: We really liked the package targeted to Canadians breakfast and valet parking included in the price. Staff was very friendly , great location!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the northwest!!!”
Reviews.Author: gtrplyr
Reviews.Content: Hello all, My wife, 4 year old, and I stayed here for three nights in August 2011. From our initial contact with the hotel we had nothing but great experiences. When we arrived by car the front entrance staff were very prompt and professional. Our luggage was removed from our car and carried inside for us, and our car was valet parked. The staff interacted very well with our 4 year old. The front desk staff had us checked in in no time and we were off to our room! When we entered our room my wife had the best hotel surprise ever.... two bathrooms!!! I have stayed in hotels with mini suites and multiple beds before, but it was a first to have two separate 4 piece bathrooms. We had another pleasant surprise shortly after entering our room. Our child had left a small toy in the lobby while we were checking in and the staff found it right away and called us in our room to let us know they had it for us. The location of the hotel couldn't be better for the typical Seattle vacation! Pike Place Market, the Aquarium, the waterfront, etc are all within a 10 minute walk. The hotel is actually attached to the Westlake Center Mall, where the Monorail boards to take you to Seattle Center (home of the Space Needle, the Science Museum, the Experience Music Project and the Children's Museum). It literally took us only 15 minutes to travel from our hotel room to the Space Needle: We walked through the hotel into the mall, onto the Monorail, and after a 2 minute ride we were at the Space Needle. Soooo convenient! We checked out early on our last day, but still had time to explore the city. The staff held our luggage for us and let us keep our car in valet parking until 6pm, at which time we loaded up and headed home. We travel a lot and I can honestly say the Mayflower is in the top 3 hotels I have stayed in. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: Art B
Reviews.Content: We live within a 45 - 60 minute drive - or a ferry or train ride - of the Mayflower Park Hotel and stay over in Seattle at least once a year just for fun. We love the hotel, including its associated restaurant, Andaluca. Service is great - hotel staff make you feel welcome from the minute you arrive. It is our favorite hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Would be excellent if shower was better”
Reviews.Author: yabutravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a friend's wedding because it was one of the hotels that had the wedding discount rate. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the valet parking is a great value ($20/day). Super convenient location to Pike Place Market and surrounding shops/restaurants. We had a car but the light rail is right downstairs if you're coming from the airport and the monorail (also right there) takes you to the Space Needle. Our room on a high floor was a bit on the small side but it was very clean and had ample electrical outlets (I find that older buildings usually don't have enough outlets). The bathroom was nice but the showerhead was really low so not very good for tall people. My partner is 6 feet tall so he had to stoop a little. The water pressure sucked so it was more like a sprinkle than a shower. We didn't ask to change rooms since it was only for 2 nights. There is a small gym that's decent and we made use of it but unfortunately, it is not open 24 hrs. Cocktails and appetizers at Oliver's were quite enjoyable although overall, I'd say hotel and bar guests are on the other side of 50 (read: Gramps would love it). In hindsight, I could probably have found a less expensive room in the same area and one where there was a hotel loyalty program but we were content staying here and it's especially great for the proximity to the wedding venue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday”
Reviews.Author: 9David9
Reviews.Content: The terrific friendly staff made our stay a memorable birthday celebration for my wife. We have stayed at the Mayflower Park in the past and always find it welcoming and comfortable. The location in ther heart of downtown Seattle is convenient to shopping and the Pike Place Market, plus you can grab the monorail for a quick trip to the Seattle Center for opera and plays and other activities. It is also just steps away from the light rail. Of course dinner at Andaluca is sensational. We are already planning another visit!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Mayflower Park!”
Reviews.Author: kaufma22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during a mini-vacation to Seattle. The location can't be beat. It's close to most of the must-see attractions (i.e., Pike Place Market, Seattle Aquarium), shopping and tons of great restaurants and coffee shops. The Space Needle was only about a 10-block walk and we walked there two times during our stay. The hotel is historic but our room was just perfect for our length of stay. The staff was great, too. We also loved that the light rail was just around the corner. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, great location close to the light rail station!!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie M
Reviews.Content: Location was the best for us!!! We do not like to rent cars on vacation and this hotel was close to everything. We walked to the Hard Rock Cafe, Pike's Market, Macys and other stores, and lots of Restauraunts and coffee shops!!! Too much to list. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming - in a GOOD way ...!”
Reviews.Author: Uebermensch
Reviews.Content: The word ‘charming’ when associated with a hotel often is a code word used to excuse a variety of ills. Not the case here! The property is historic and charming, as well as luxurious - without sacrifices. Everything was perfect! The location is ideal, the staff is great, the rooms are well-appointed, and there is a nice bar and a fantastic restaurant within the property that the ‘locals’ regularly visit (hotel guests are captive audiences for an on-site bar or restaurant – if the locals go, that tells me something). Oh, and the in-room wireless is fast and free (my pet peeve is when a hotel gouges guests with high internet access fees) – great in-room coffee, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! We will definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: lgmiller
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with comfortable walking distance to waterfront, Pioneer Square, etc. Right next to the light rail station which is a great way to ride in from the airport. Staff was super friendly and helpful, lovely atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, wonderful, love love loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dana P
Reviews.Content: After traveling for a week this was my last hotel I stayed at. It was WONDERFUL!! The beds were so comfortable i got the best night sleep in a week! I was amazed how quiet the room was as it faces the main street. The staff there was incredable and very helpful! I am planning another stay there in october for my aniversary..

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Marianne1030
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this hotel whenever we come to Seattle, and we have never been disappointed. The building has a lot of character and the service is always excellent. Also a great location, especially now that you can take the train from Westlake Mall (adjoining the hotel) to Safeco Field - we are usually in town to see the Blue Jays games. It may not be the cheapest but it is worth the price - you get what you pay for! Our only complaint was that the shower head was very low - and being an older property the bathrooms are on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Seattle and the Mayflower Parl Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayE1501
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Seattle, stay at the Mayflower Park Hotel. Great location, great rooms (twin queen beds - two bathrooms), great service. Food and service at Andalucas and Oliver's Lounge Bar was fantastic. Definitely will be staying there again on my next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will always be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda Y
Reviews.Content: Old world charm w/ modern conveniences. Warm and friendly always. Great beds, peaceful rooms. Excellent bar!

Reviews.Title: “Will return.”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Great location. Quaint rooms which push you outside( all good) . Reastautrant and bar very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Mayflower... we will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_A_T
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Mayflower for just one night and the service was outstanding. This is our 4th stay at this hotel and each time we have been treated very well. I tried to book online but experienced "technical" problems so I called. Mary- you were so helpful. She booked us in a standard queen and we arrived Richard had a great surprise. A lovely upgrade to the 12th floor suite...What can I say! The staff really made our anniversary the best... Many thanks to all. We will be back! And thank you for the signed card and chocolates!

Reviews.Title: “It was Fabulous and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: SweetSue2011
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Hotel exceeded our expectations and was first class service all the way! It was a nice touch and a great surprise to receive an anniversary card and chocolates sent by the staff. The room was great - very spacious and with 2 bathrooms. We loved it all - enjoyed dinner at the Andeluca - delicious food and wonderful service. We have bragged about the Mayflower to all of our friends and relatives! Wish we could have stayed longer - just a short walk to Pike's Market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & great service!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea N
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Mayflower. When I called to make reservations, the reservations rep was sooooo helpful and informative. And I was not disappointed when we arrived. Every person that I dealt with from the Bellman to the Concierge to the Front Desk Personnel were truly service oriented and friendly as well. I was so impressed. This hotel, obviously, trains their staff very well. And the hotel is also located in a great place -- next to several restaurants like the Dahlia Lounge, Lola's & Serious Pie and lots of shopping like Macy's, boutiques, etc. Wonderful experience! Will stay here on my next visit for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: EmiSC
Reviews.Content: Beds and linens were the best. Close to Pike's Place and public transportation

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Kateb07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in a standard room. The hotel has a more older feel compared to the hotel we stayed in before arriving in Seattle which was more modern, however, this is part of the charm of the hotel. The hotel was very clean and our room albeit a bit small was clean and functional overlooking Macy’s. We enjoyed drinks in the hotel bar and the Lemon Martini is very good! The hotel is in a very central location, a 5/10 minutes walk to Pike Place Market and the front, next door to a shopping centre and also the Monorail link that takes you directly to Space Needle. There are 2 computers in the hotel lobby with free internet access for guests which was very useful for us to check our flights. A special mention to Wendy in concierge who was fantastic on our first day and gave us lots of hints and tips on what to do and where to eat. I also asked for a vase one day to put the flowers I bought from Pike Place Market and this was delivered to our room within 5 minutes of the request. We had breakfast here on our last day at the hotel which was very good and a good selection on the menu although I was still adjusting to US portions so slightly over ordered! Would we stay here again? Yes especially for the cleanliness and charm of the hotel, the friendly hotel staff and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DonBPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within easy walking distance to Pike Market, the waterfront, shopping and numerous restaurants. We arrived Monday at about 11 AM and was upgraded to a room with a wet bar (no booze), fridge and jacuzzi. The room also had a safe which could be operated by choosing combination or a credit card. Read the directions first. The room was clean and fresh. There were plenty of towels and closet space and also a bathrobe for each of us. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was no ice machine on our floor but the maid brought ice each morning and afternoon. The lobby is stately and quiet as well as the bar and restaurantThe hotel is connected by walkway to the Westlake Center (shopping mall) which is the downtown stop for the monorail. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShashNj
Reviews.Content: Just completed a four night stay at this lovely hotel. Staff was very friendly, hotel immaculate, room well appointed and very quiet. We also loved the location. We have stayed in this area before (at the Westin) but preferred this small, boutique hotel by far. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lfalaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very centrally located. Could walk to restaurants, movies, Pike Market...Took the light rail into the city from SEA/TAC and then a very short walk to the hotel. Front desk was helpful. The doormen were great. They happily hailed taxis when needed. We had a standard room, not huge but fine. Clean and quiet. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park Hotel really knows how to treat their guests well. The customer service is excellent; everyone was friendly, helpful, and made you feel special. The hotel has been remodeled from 1927 but still has kept the old charm, especially with the grand piano that plays in the upper lobby. The concierge was extremely helpful multiple times, and gave a great restaurant suggestion that was delicious. It is centrally located to many attractions, so just vallet your car and go enjoy Seattle. It was great having the hotel directly connected inside to the monorail that goes to the Space Needle and a mini mall with shops and eateries. It is also by the light rail which goes to and from the airport, so you don't even need a car if you're staying only in Seattle. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have the most comfortable beds I ever slept in. We stayed in two different sized suites at two different stays on our vacation which both had ample room for five of us. The rooms are very clean. The hotel website is great. There are also computers in the lobby where you may print out any needed documents, in my case our boarding passes for our return flight. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Celebrate our Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: 60878Bob
Reviews.Content: Great location! Staff was very helpful, friendly, and remembered our name. Our room was quiet and comfortable. Also,we recommend that you have a beverage in lobby bar. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable elegance”
Reviews.Author: Fredtheneedle57
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times and have never been disappointed. Indeed it is our default hotel for Seattle. The location is convenient for many things. For shopping it is right across the road from Macy's, adjacent to the Westlake Centre, and just a few blocks from Pike Place Market. Many good restaurants are nearby: our favourite splurge restaurants are the Dahlia Lounge and the Waterfront Seafood Grill (which is right on the water). It is also close to art galleries and the football and baseball stadiums. Less than 50 yards away there is a rail station serving the airport, and the Westlake Centre is the terminus for the Monorail, which runs to the Seattle Centre with its Rock and Roll Museum, Opera House, Space Needle and fairground. The hotel itself is an elegant old-timer which has been very tastefully restored, the lobby with with a more modern Japanese-style decor. The rooms have all been modernised with great beds and efficient plumbing. The high-ceilinged bar is one of our favourite features (be sure to try the Citronella cocktail, one of the best ever). The restaurant features high-end food that puts it near the top of the Seattle list of favourites. The breakfast are all great - try their excellent eggs benedict.The stafff has always been very friendly and accommodating. Overall, the hotel is a classy bargain, especially if you can get AAA or CAA rates.

Reviews.Title: “good location, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: kktravelin
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this hotel. In fact quite the opposite. The front desk staff were great, the bell hops super nice. The door man were exceptional. The bar restaurant was nice to lounge in, waitstaff was friendly. Everyone was nice here, made for a great experience. The hotel location was great, right in the middle of Macys and Nordstrom, perfect!! Not far from the waterfront or capital hill. I recommend this hotel to any one staying a few days in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsHereNthere
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower was a fancy and comfortable hotel in a great location. The rooms were spacious and clean, and included a very comfortable bed! It was easy to get a cab from here, thanks to the taxi stand at the entrance. The hotel offers free wireless internet, which was a plus. It is also easy and free to print out boarding passes in the lobby. The hotel staff were all very attentive. I really enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge and staff were remarkable”
Reviews.Author: MandSEvanstonIL
Reviews.Content: We immediately liked the look and feel of this hotel. It is very conveniently located for those of us taking public transportation from the airport. All the members of the staff were gracious and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite on the 10th floor and were very pleased with it. The curtains in the bedroom allowed us to make the room very dark, which made for a great nights sleep. The housekeeping service was wonderful. Both concierges were incredible and helped make our stay fantastic. We thank them. It was an easy walk to Puget Sound and all the sights there. The monorail was easily accessed - we didn't have to walk outside to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: PetePodolski
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from reviews previously read on TripAdvisor. I was thoroughly impressed with the standard of room which was assigned to me. I had a room on the second floor and was very elegant and stylish. Even though the room faced Olive Street, and i thought it would be noisy, as soon as i closed the curtains the sound cut down 90% and after sunset there was hardly any traffic. The bed was lovely and had ample blankets and pillows. Came with a little bar fridge for cold drinks. The ensuite bathroom was a good size and ample room for movement. The room safe was also a nice feature and gave me peace of mind. The staff were very very courteous and lovely, and one of the attendants out from was particularly friendly and gave me lots of good tips about the city and places to run, and also had a few laughs. Fantastic also that it was so close to the main shopping hub! 1 street away and could also get to one of the malls (with some shopping and food) through an access corridor. All in all, i feel that it was very good value for the price i paid and would recommend The Mayflower to anyone wanting to stay in Seattle and be close to the shopping district, and also the bay, without having to pay for the exorbitant prices that some other places were charging. The Mayflower has it all. Will be back there in the future for sure! Thanks again for a lovely stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great visit and hope to be back.”
Reviews.Author: GFarrall
Reviews.Content: We met up with friends before our 2 week cruise to Alaska. Spent time in Oliver's Lounge catching up with them. The Hotel was in a great location, easy access from Airport and downtown attractions. This hotel has a lot of history attached to it. The staff were very courteous and attentive to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: ExSpec5
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park is old (for Seattle), which is a good thing. It's a top-quality, established, conservative kind of place, centrally located in the middle of downtown. Lots of great places to eat nearby. The room was not large, but well appointed. Excellent lines and bathroom amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: succeed_2
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and especially the location. It was SO easy to take the Link Light Rail from the airport to the Westlake Center, and then walk around the corner to the hotel. For a price of $2.75 each, we had a comfortable 35 minute ride and a chance to see some of the surrounding parts of the Seattle area. At the hotel, we were greeted warmly and shortly after making our way to our room, the front desk called up to make sure everything was okay. What a special touch! Our room was excellent - lots of space, great shower, very comfortable bed, and we heard absolutely no noise from the hallway, from above, or from the street below (we were on the 10th floor, overlooking Macy's). There was lots of shopping nearby. And in case you forgot something at home, just one street over is a Bartell Drugs, with a really good selection of essentials (including snack food). The famous Pike Place Market is just a few blocks down. And there are lots of eateries and coffee shops everywhere you turn. You really can't beat the excellent location, friendly service, and beautiful accommodation of the Mayflower Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: Pono
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Seattle, in my opinion. Beautiful and clean, great service and ammenities and best of all... within walking distance to EVERYTHING (shopping, monorail, restaurants, Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square... you name it!) I will definitely stay here again and I have been telling all my friends about it! As a local doing a downtown romantic weekend getaway... this hotel was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic, w/ up-to-date conveniences, great location”
Reviews.Author: RuthArmen
Reviews.Content: Why stay in a cookie cutter franchise like Marriott when you can stay here? There are far more employees willing to help you than in the typical business hotel. Excellent staff, clean up-to-date facilities in a historic setting in the heart of downtown Seattle, minutes away by foot from my favorite gelato place near Pike's Public Market.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Shonachris
Reviews.Content: This has one of the best locations in Seattle for just the tourist not having a vehicle. We did a four day stopover on our way to an Alaskan Cruise, looked for ages to find the right spot and so glad this is the one we selected. Opposite Macy's, one block from the Train and bus station, Monorail at the back door, easy walk to Pike Markets and heaps of food places around the hotel. It is an awesome hotel, so friendly and the rooms are brilliant. We had a queen bed, found we wanted a King, so requested it and the office guys did their best. Upgraded us to a King for minimal cost and it was superb, this is the best hotel for the overseas traveller. Highly recommend it, clean, tidy, cosy and just the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Kllhhmm
Reviews.Content: We have been coming back for 8 years, would't stay any where else in downtown Seattle. Great service, warm and friendly. Lovely decor. Oliver's is the best martini bar around. They go above and beyond to meet all your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: HedoHP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel by recommendation of a business partner and it was fabulous. It has wonderful historic charm and is in an amazing location. After valet parking our car, a ride up in the quaint elevator, and quickly unpacking, we were able to walk to pikes market for diner and some sight seeing. The rooms are well decorated to preserve the history. Note: historic does equal small so if you need lots of space or have several people to stay in a room, this is not for you. I certainly wouldn't pick this room for my large spouse as he would complain all night about the small space and small bed. But I LOVED it. In the morning, I took a quick walk around downtown and appreciated the central location of this hotel! Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location a little bit of history”
Reviews.Author: joylpetersen
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, right in the heart of downtown Seattle. Great Bar and a separate restaurant. Comfortable rooms, but be prepared for low shower heads, but great bathtubs.

Reviews.Title: “We always enjoy our stay and will be back.”
Reviews.Author: apantzaras
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. We never have to use our car during our stay. The staff at this hotel are very courteous. We would never stay elsewhere when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “excellent walking tour starts at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sciptac
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because we had booked a gourmet walking tour which started in the hotel lobby and stayed for two nights. We found the hotel stay very pleasant with particular helpfulness of the staff. The concierge service , for example had free entry to the Japanese Garden made available to us. The location is excellent for walking to Pike Street , the Wharf or the Convention Centre., the Art Gallery and downtown. The room was rather small but well appointed and maintained. Breakfast at the restaurant was excellent and Oliver's was pleasant for an apperitif.. We certainly would use them again (and take the gourmet tour again also)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gwhizrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after we returned to Seattle from our cruise. The price was very reasonable and it was nice being downtown and close to everything. Check out isn't until noon, so there's plenty of time to do additional exploring before check out. Room was very clean and very quiet. Staff was good and very helpful. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with a few Quirks”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaW
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel in a corner "suite". I don't know why I booked that, I suspect it was all that was available for my dates as I didn't need that much space. It was a large room with the bed at one end and the other end was a sitting area with small couch, coffee table and TV. The hotel was very nice, the room large, and it's a good location for sightseeing around Seattle and it is super because it is within a block of the light rail stop from the airport. The quirks I mentioned are that for this level of hotel, the TV was very small (probably a 24 inch flat screen) so that it was too small to really view from the bed, you had to be in the "sitting area". I've been in cheap chain motels with TV screens bigger than that. But the thing that bother me the most was that the bathroom is very weird in design, I don't know what they were thinking. There are no towel racks! So if you use a hand towel near the sink, there is nowhere to hang it, you have to drape it over the edge of the tub or something. Very strange. The only towel rack is that one at the end, inside the tub high up, where they pile extra towels at times. There isn't a single towel rack on the wall otherwise. And there is a small glass shelf over the sink (under a mirror) which sticks out over where the sink and faucet begin--so if you lean over to wash your face in the sink, you have to be careful or you hit your head. I was also very annoyed that I stressed many times that I wanted a quiet room and they gave me a room next to a couple with an infant that woke me up the first two days screaming at 4-5 am. Luckily I think they moved out after that. I think the walls are fairly thin which compounded the problem, which surprised me for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will return.”
Reviews.Author: moleskinMary
Reviews.Content: Rooms, lobby, staff, food and beverage, location; all ideal for us. Appreciated the Love Thy Neighbour (Canadians) package. Our stay in Seattle reconfirmed our affection for our Northwest Coast neighbours. We hope to return soon, perhaps to take in Porgy and Bess.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was perfect and we'll be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: SteveMarie20
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay was arranged by Clipper Vacations travelling from Victoria. The hotel was easy to get to and close to everything. Room was very nicely appointed and the bed was the most comfortable we'd ever slept in while away from home. We didn't get a chance to eat at Andaluca but we enjoyed a couple of nice drinks in Oliver's. This bar has got to be the best anywhere. Kicking out the old school cocktails with a nice friendly accomodating manner. Really no negatives to speak of at all. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The entire building is well kept and you can tell it's managed with pride. We will defintiely be back to enjoy the hospitality at the Maryflower many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay & we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: vanalstine_lindy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I organized a weekend in Seattle to see a show, shop & take in the Seattle sites! We travelled on the Clipper from Victoria & booked the Mayflower Park Hotel as one of their recommendations. From the moment we checked in, we felt like VIP's and nothing was too much trouble for the friendly & very efficient staff throughout the hotel! We thoroughly enjoyed the facilities in the hotel, with 2 visits to Oliver's lounge! What a fabulous place for ambience, delicious appetizers & a great variety of drink selections! The concierge was very helpful with suggesting restaurants & directions to the Pike Street Market, shopping areas & the theatre for the musical, 'Mary Poppins'. We were within walking distance for everything, which was fabulous! Many thanks to the Mayflower Park Hotel management & staff for such a delightful stay! Lindy Van Alstine & Mary Garraway

Reviews.Title: “An elegant old-world hotel at the center of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Islephile
Reviews.Content: I've always remembered my beautiful stays at the Mayflower Park in the 80's, so when i planned to take my grand daughter on a very special trip to introduce her to Seattle, I knew I had to stay here again. It was just as beautiful and cozy as I had remembered. Excellent service, beautifully appointed room. I surely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dental Convention”
Reviews.Author: Shemstrom
Reviews.Content: I took a plane into Seatac, and then walked to the light rail and rode the train into downtown Seattle for $2.75. The hotel was only 2 blocks away. I attended the convention for 2 days and was able to leave my bags at the hotel until late on the night I was leaving for no extra charge. The hotel is a beautifully restored and updated hotel. Nice workers and very clean. The only odd thing was the amount of plug -ins and the locations of them. The bathroom had only one plug in, and no counter. It was a pedistal sink with a small shelf above it. That was a little inconvienent. In the room all the plugs were on a long strip at the floor level, and one on the desk lamp. The bed was a bit firm, but not uncomfortable. Nice robes were provide, and the walk in closet was very spacious. One morning at 6 am I heard a loud yelling coming from the street, I got up to see a couple local homeless people arguing, but found it entertaining. The location was very centrally located to shopping, the Convention Center and if I had wanted to go, the Space Needle. I got the room through priceline, for $99.00, which is awesome for this type of hotel. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: julimarie
Reviews.Content: Everything from the moment we drove up to when we left was perfect! The service was amazing. It is so beautiful and we will be back! I wouldn't stay anywhere else now that I've been there. The location was wonderful as well. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: plcape
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location in Downtown Seattle. Close to shoppipng and about 4 blocks to waterfront. Also close to light rail to airport. Hotel staff was quick and couteous on arrival. Room was nice but not large. Still very comfortablle for 2 and very clean. Small lobby but nice. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roj58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Mayflower Park. It was a great hotel close to city centre, public transport and shops. The public transport was free up to certain zones. The market was a short stroll away. We had a spacious room with a comfortable bed. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was ready when we arrived early.I booked directly through the hotel as the price was comparable to internet booking sites. Free internet was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: robinlecky
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Mayflower Park many times over many years...and we continue to return. Ideal city center location, beautifully maintained facilities, warm and helpful staff. Also a very good restaurant - Andaluca - and the always great Oliver's bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the perfect location to enjoy Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Lynn2257
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation with Trip advisor and when we arrived at the Hotel they had upgraded our room from a queen size bed room to a one bedroom suite. We were delighted with the hotel setting, staff and location. My daughter and i had a wonderful family vacation. Thank you Mayflower Park Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great as always!”
Reviews.Author: spocant
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Mayflower at least 6 times a year. We always have a great time. The staff is friendly and efficient. We're at the point where they remember us, which makes each visit even more fun. The rooms are comfortable and clean and we often get a complimentary upgrade to a 2 room / 2 bath suite. They even filled the ice bucket for us as part of the turn down service which I certainly didn't expect, but was happy to get. The on site restaurant Andaluca has been great each time we've eaten there. We've also had their room service breakfast which was generous and delicious. We often get the breakfast package which includes valet parking. Oliver's has great drinks and it's now our "tradition" to stop there after we check in for a snack and a cocktail. Sloooowly working my way through the martini menu! The location is perfect for our needs. We're within walking distance of the light rail system and the monorail. And of course, there's plenty of shopping, coffee shops and restaurants all nearby. It does book up fast, so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkriley011
Reviews.Content: We really did love the service and our stay here during the Seattle marathon. I should've checked the site better because I thought there was a pool or a spa and there was not. Also, we didn't have a refrigerator in our room which would've been useful since we were traveling with a baby. The tv was smaller than we would have liked and it is far away from the beds to watch tv, we aren't big tv watchers, so that wasn't too much of a problem. The staff's service was beyond a doubt the best service we have had in a long while, which is extremely important. Our biggest concern was that there is a lot of traffic outside the windows and things going on and there is no fan or unit to turn on in the room to drown out that noise, so we had trouble falling asleep the first couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharonW_74
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Park is a lovely hotel - lots of charm and by that, I do not mean a shabby hotel that was once nice. The hotel is historic and very well maintained. Staff is polite, friendly and efficient. You absolutely cannot beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Comfort downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJazzA Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked for my first couple of nights in Seattle - wonderful position easy to find having got the train into town after flying in. Comfortable rooms, very clean and very friendly staff. Free Wifi throughout with a strong signal. Two on site choices - Mediterranean restaurant or Olivers which has bar snacks and great selection of cocktails, liquor and wine. As its downtown then its minutes to any shopping or restaurants - and only a 10 minute walk to Pike Place Market. Perfect start to my holiday.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: classclady808
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for two nights in May 2011 before setting sail on our Alaska Cruise. This was our first trip to Seattle, and after doing some online research we chose to stay here. Traveling was myself, my husband, my father & mother. We had two Queen rooms that were very spacious, and our room had two queen beds and two bathrooms...LOVED THAT! The beds were very comfortable and the room decor was beautiful and very clean. We ate breakfast both mornings at the onsite restaurant, Andaluca, and highly recommend it. The food was delicious! We enjoyed hanging out in Oliver's as well. The drinks and waitress/bartender were awesome! This hotel is conveniently located downtown within walking distance to many of the major attractions. We walked to Pike Place, the waterfront, aquarium, Macy's, Nordstrom's and even to the Queen Anne district for dinner. This is a true gem in Seattle and we would definitely stay here again! We highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Seattle. We loved everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: painnurse01
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel sight unseen from the Seattle Rock & Roll Marathon website hoping it would be "okay." It was wonderful! I booked our traveling friends there also and they were so impressed by my choice. I cannot name one reason not to stay there. It is close to everything downtown. It is immaculately clean and beautiful. Everyone, from the bellmen to the front desk to housekeeping could not have been nicer. We will definitely book again. Thank you to everyone who made our stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, even better service”
Reviews.Author: nalontap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower prior to an Alaskan Cruise. Every aspect of our stay there was wonderful. We took advantage of their great pre-cruise package which included a wonderful full breakfast and transportation to the pier. Our room was lovely, clean, comfortable and well appointed. The concierge and front desk staff were cheerful and helped with everything from dinner reservations to replacing a lost certificate for a discounted dinner in their (not to be missed) dining room. I would love to return for a longer stay at this lovely hotel, and more in-depth visit to this charming city .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Seattle Visit”
Reviews.Author: OhioIrish
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Seattle and the Mayflower Hotel was the perfect place for us to stay. As noted by other reviewers, the location is a serious plus - walk to Pike Market and the waterfront and next door to all transportation (light rail, buses, and streetcar). The staff is friendly and professional - very hotel employee greeted or spoke with us - and assisted with restaurant recommendations and directions. Be sure to have drinks and appetizers at Olivers (Hotel bar). Our room (10th floor corner) was very clean, quiet, and well appointed. Housekeeping personnel noted when we left the room and serviced it immediately so that when we returned it was cleaned and ready for us. The bellcaps even helped my husband map out a route for his morning runs. This is a great hotel for your Seattle vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calonso
Reviews.Content: Our first time there... we had a lovely corner room . Had a wonderful breakfast the next morning in Andaluca.. wish we could have spent more time. Only in Seattle for the one night. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place--good value”
Reviews.Author: petrock2002
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very friendly even though I arrived after midnight. Accommodations were comfortable and clean. I would stay here again the next time I go to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: terrocon
Reviews.Content: This is the best location for taking the Sound Link and the tram. Shopping is a door away! The rooms were quiet, the beds very comfortable and the restaurant had great food. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaBaWaWas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Seattle many times, for business and pleasure. For convention use this hotel is a tad far but for pleasure and "doing" Seattle it is right in the thick of things, close to the Pike Market, shopping, monorail, and restaurants. We got a great rate and had a first class experience. A small hotel with very courteous staff. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler57M
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a trip to Seattle celebrating our 40th anniversary and had a great time thanks to Trip Advisor. We stayed at the Mayflower Park and couldn't have asked for anything better. It's a beautiful hotel in a good location. We had a one bedroom corner suite, which gave us more than enough room to walk around. No noise in the hallways or coming through walls and very clean. We were touched to find a card wishing us a happy anniversary with a small box of candy. Everyone we came in contact with was friendly. We did the Boeing Tour & City Tour with Show Me Seattle. Nice to not have to battle the downtown traffic and one way streets. Both guides were friendly and informative. We also did the Queen of Seattle ride on Lake Union. It was nice to see the community of houseboats, including the houseboat from the Sleepless in Seattle movie. One day we did the Space Needle, and yes it was a bit expensive. But...it is the Space Needle and something I wanted to do. Definitely worth it. Plus they will take your picture as you are walking up the elevator, then send it to you via e-mail. The only thing about our trip that surprised us was the steep hills. It didn't stop us from walking down to the waterfront, but it was a bit of a challenge coming back up. For dinner, we ate at Il Fortunaio and enjoyed it. Father's Day we ate at the Six Seven Restaurant on the waterfront. We had a great brunch and a beautiful view. It was definitely a trip we will remember.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & great location!”
Reviews.Author: beh614
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Mayflower Park because of its location. Easy to walk to the Market, easy to get on the free 'business district' city busses. Literally next door to the Westlake Shopping Center to pick up the monorail to the Space Needle. I saw a sign that the light rail to the airport had a location either there or nearby. The hotel itself is beautiful! It is not 'modern' in the sense that the rooms are not large, but all the ammenities were available. The staff was very helpful with any questions and we enjoyed the free wine tasting in Andaluca's that evening. Everything was exactly what we looked for. We've stayed in historic inns and hotels before, so we appreciate the "character" and "personality" of an older building. Would highly recommend it for its simplicity and convenient location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: HeyJude55
Reviews.Content: From the minute the 4 of us arrived at Mayflower Park, we were treated like valued guests. The lobby is beautiful and peaceful, and the front desk staff was very welcoming. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe suite, which had a seating area and 2 bathrooms. This was perfect for 4 ladies traveling together! The location of the hotel could not be more perfect - lots of shopping and restaurants nearby, as well as only 3 blocks down to Pike Place Market. The bellboys and the concierge both gave us great suggestions for places to eat nearby. We even had two meals at Elephant and Castle we liked it so much! Another great suggestion was the Icon Grill. Great shopping in every direction from the hotel, and it is in a very safe area. We took the Light Rail from the airport to Westlake Center, and had no problem finding our way to the hotel. We chose to take a cab (town car, actually) to the airport on our way home, as we were unsure how long it would take us to catch light rail, walk to our airline check-in and get through security. I can't imagine a nicer place to stay in Seattle. The housekeeping staff even came in twice a day, with our beds turned down in the evening. The beds were very comfortable with nice pillows and bedding. We really liked the smaller hotel and felt that the attention to detail was wonderful. The hotel is also very clean, which is important to us. We enjoyed a complimentary wine tasting on Wednesday evening at the hotel, and had lunch one day at Oliver's - the hamburgers were great! Two of us got up really early every day (5:30ish) and walked all around the downtown area. We tried a different coffee shop each morning, and it was so much fun. I can't imagine anyone not being extremely pleased with this hotel - everyone we encountered was very gracious and helpful. The desk clerk even let each of us pay for one night of our stay on our credit cards so we didn't have to split the bill among ourselves! I have traveled a lot, and this hotel surpassed any other place I have stayed, especially in the price range. I kind of hate to give Mayflower Park such a great recommendation because I'm afraid they won't have rooms available if I travel to Seattle again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! We will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: Di_and_Mike_2010
Reviews.Content: Visting from Vancouver for a weekend get-away we chose the 'our friends from the north' package which included complimentary valet parking. We walked everywhere, including to the Mariners game (30 minutes). Close to everything. Great location, beautiful old hotel that has been totally updated, gorgeous room, and great staff. We'll definitely be back! The Mayflower is our new favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Becoming my favorite in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hpfl
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect location (both in terms of Seattle and access to the airport via the Link) and it's a great hotel. Wonderful staff and very pleasant if small rooms. Easy for me to recommend especially for single travelers or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and great service!!”
Reviews.Author: well-traveled32
Reviews.Content: My husband and my parents went on a cruise to Alaska just last week. Our cruise left out of Seattle, so we decided to fly in the day before our cruise was scheduled to depart and explore Seattle for the day. After doing some research, I chose to book the Mayflower Park Hotel. I had never seen so many great reviews for a hotel, so I was sure I made a good choice. And as it turns out, I did. I had requested a higher floor with a view, and not only was that request honored, but we were also upgraded to a suite with 2 bathrooms and a separate living area with a great view of the space needle!! This is a beautiful and unique hotel with great service and a great location. The Pike Place market was a couple blocks away, and the monorail to the space needle was around the block. There are also a lot of great cafes and restaurants within walking distance. When we arrived at the airport, we just took the light rail to the Westlake Station, and the hotel was a block away. The fare for each person on the rail was $2.75. This definitely beats the cab fare for the 30 - 45 minute ride downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Seattle. You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, definitely will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: grizguest
Reviews.Content: Great location, great door service, great lounge, twice a day maid service. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: BmoreLaura
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there for 3 nights on a business trip. I will not be staying there again. The walls are not sound-proofed at all, so you can hear every little sound in neighboring rooms. I had an extremely noisy couple in the room next to me who kept me up until 4 am when I had to get up at 6 am for my work obligations. The bathroom floor and tub were moldy. My company paid for my stay in full ahead of time, about $400. I gave them my credit card up front for incidentals, and they put a $1600 hold on it and attempted to charge me for $800. Luckily, my credit card company alerted me to the unusual transaction. When I called the hotel to ask for the charges, they stated that they only did an $800 hold, which is still a lot for a stay already paid in full. It took a while to remove the $1600 hold. Luckily, my credit card company called me. Otherwise, I would have been mistakenly charged $800 of that $1600 hold.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel package for cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: nocola
Reviews.Content: We (another couple and my wife and I) use the pre-cruise package. First of all very nice hotel. Easy to get to from the airport. Had I known just how easy the rail system was and how close it was (like it is right at the mall connected to the hotel) this may have bee the way to get there from the airport. Great location and walking distance to everything that one would probably want to see on a one night stay over. East check in and check out. The breakfast included was just fantastic (not a continental buffet deal). The included transportaion and tip from the driver on how to get ahead of the cruise terminal check in process was most time saving! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still good after all these years.”
Reviews.Author: ljc3003
Reviews.Content: First visit in 15 years or so and were not disappointed. Location can't be beat: downtown, on central bus and light rail from Airport route, short walk to Pike Place Market, port and ferries and right at the Monorail. Very clean and accommodating. 2 Caveats: free Apple TV didn't work because buffering took too long and always timed out. Slow Wi-Fi probably the cause. Also, access for wheelchair is available, but had to go out into the rain rather than through the shopping/transportation complex, and exterior door very, very heavy and hard to get attention of front desk to get assistance with it. Good, clean and well-equipped fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all aspects.”
Reviews.Author: dingley
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The hotel is in the middle of town so you could walk everywhere with ease. The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful. The concierges were excellent and were always happy to advise and give ideas and directions. They even booked all our trips which saved us time. . All attractions were good and within walking distance from the hotel The rooms were very comfortable and offered all comforts. Having the internet was handy. We were happy with our stay and after five weeks in other hotels in USA we couldn't complain. Seattle is an interesting place and in the 5 days it only rained one morning which was great for Seattle we believe. In fact it was warm and sunny. A thoroughly enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Always stay at Mayflower Park”
Reviews.Author: OregonMember
Reviews.Content: When in Seattle, I always stay at the Mayflower Park Hotel. I like its central location - walking distance to shopping, restaurants, Pike Place, museum, and with the light rail, stadiums. I usually get a deluxe room ... seating area and a little more room. Clean, comfortably furnished. Staff friendly, helpful. The only negative: the bathrooms all seems to be very small.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lizetteduT
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms etc. If ever we visit Seattle again, we will definately stay there! Johan & Lizette, Windhoek, Namibia.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinSioux
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding from start to finish and the staff could not be more helpful all around from arriving to leaving. We arrived early, they stored our bags, we want about town and then they called on our cell phone to tell us our room was ready. Best hotel I have stayed at in years for service and being a Hilton Gold member with over a month in their hotels last year they could take a lesson on service from the Mayflower Park! Close to all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elledub
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for the weekend for a Seahawks game. We got a package that included parking which was a great deal for us because even though we checked out on the Sunday which was game day we were allowed to leave our car at the hotel and took transit down to the game. I was very pleased with my whole experience with this hotel starting with the reservations agent who was very friendly and knowledgable.The conceirge at the hotel was absolutely amazing and was able to answer all our questions about restaurants, directions and shopping. The rooms were very nicely appointed and our room service breakfast that we ordered the night before came right on time and beautifully presented. The location of this hotel is perfect! Right near all kinds of restaurants and shopping and public transit. I would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mayflower Park all about personal service!”
Reviews.Author: mlabberton
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle frequently and have stayed at almost all the downtown hotels. I decided to try the Mayflower Park because they have a great bar, "Olivers," and a great restaurant "Andaluca." I made my reservations with the Reservations Manager Craig Packer and he couldn't have been nicer. We arrived late on a Friday night and had been upgraded to a lovely suite on the 12th floor! It reminded us of rooms at the much more pricey Fairmont Olympic! Since it's an older hotel, it has that European quality and from the valet to the front desk, the service is very personal and old school as well. We're definitely going to stay there again, plus the location right in the heart of the downtown shopping district is terrific! Bravo Mayflower staff...keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel with a cheerful homely atmosphere and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: fantasmographic
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel has a very friendly welcoming atmosphere thanks to wonderful staff who go about their work in a cheerful and highly efficient manner. We had room 720 which is a corner room with views up and down 4th Avenue. There is a mezzanine corridor connection to the Westgate shopping mall which is connected to the public transport tunnels incuding a railway to Sea-Tac airport for only $2.50. Across the road from the hotel is the famous Macy's and one block away is the Nordstrom department store. In the hotel Oliver's Cocktail Lounge and Andaluca restaurant enthusiastic expertise was evident. The cocktails and meals we enjoyed are probably among the best to be had in the city. The hotel slogan claims it to be "Quite Simply One Of A Kind". My wife and I can testify that this is true.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chintz1
Reviews.Content: Mayflower Park Hotel was assigned to us by Priceline. It is nicely located in downtown Seattle and within walking distance from most attractions. We had a room with a single queen on the 10th floor. It was spotlessly clean and we had a great view of downtown all the way out to the water. The rooms are nicely furnished with wonderful linens. This is an old hotel that is well maintained. But with it's age comes smallness. The elevator is small as was our room. I did have some trouble in the bathroom due to the lack of places to put my items. There are also few electrical outlets. After stringing cords all the way across the room, we found a plug strip in the desk drawer. They have free wireless internet which worked well. The service was great and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LCP2010
Reviews.Content: A wonderful historic hotel located within close walking distance to Pike Place Market, the Space Needle and other attractions. The hotel has a wonderful cozy restaurant which proved a lifesaver after we were too ahem tired from our day of wineries and slept through our Palisades dinner reservations. The staff is funny and helpful, we especially loved our singing valet. The hotel is historic without being musty and tired, although be prepared to wait for the super slow and quite small elevators. However, it what was a real perk this room has ample outlets!!! And even provides a powerstrip. Also free wifi. Parking is a little steep but no more so than other hotels in the area and you get in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SlowHeart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located for tourism or business in downtown Seattle. It's smart, friendly, and well appointed. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the heart of downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: bselfridge
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are very nice and beds have high quality linens. They have no problems with you leaving your car parked in the garage until 5 pm on the day of check out if you are wanting to explore downtown Seattle. Great location! Right next to Westlake Center and a block or two away from Pacific Place shopping center. It is also within walking distance of the Pikes Place Market. Make sure you check out thier special promotions, as there are often good deals. I got a package which included parking and two passes to the Pacific Science Center with entry into the special exhibit at the time (which was a Star Wars exhibit) at a very good price. I would definitely recommed this hotel. It is not the cheapest, but is very high quality, so you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort”
Reviews.Author: suziekw
Reviews.Content: Exactly the service and amenities you need and nothing you don't. I felt comforted, warmly welcomed, calmed, and cared for. It was perfect. I will stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully attentive staff and comfortable, traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: dberinati
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days/3 nights, and during that period held a memorial party in the Fireside Room for a recently deceased family member. Andrew Harris in catering did a great job putting together the party for us, as we were all from out of town and had no one on the ground other than him and his staff. Everywhwere we went in the hotel, whether Oliver's Bar or the front desk or the valet parking or housekeeping, people were kind and patient and seemed to know that what we needed was just plain comfort and minimal stress. By the end of our stay, we felt as if we had extended our family to include the hotel. I would enthusiastically endorse and recommend this old hotel to anyone visiting Seattle. Not only is it extremely well-located wrt local sights, but you're in for a treat when you come 'home'.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine hospitality in a comfortable yet elegant setting!”
Reviews.Author: Abruzzo7
Reviews.Content: When we are visiting Seattle, our hotel of choice is the Mayflower Park. Not only is the downtown location ideal, the friendly and attentive staff is remarkable. While the ambiance is elegant, the atmosphere is warm and inviting. Be sure to visit Andaluca, the hotel restaurant. Fresh & unique cuisine is served in a lovely space and the extensive wine list is a plus. Oliver's lounge is popular with hotel guests and locals alike. All in all the Mayflower Hotel experience is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: NWFamily034
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline and were able to upgrade to a double bed with 2 bathrooms for $20 when we ended up bringing our children along. On the 12th floor with a great view of the space needle. Staff was very helpful with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Seattle Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TheresaR13
Reviews.Content: First visit to Seattle and found this hotel to be extremely well located. The staff and their service was flawless. The only downside was that it was a bit noisy in the morning with the traffic but then it is downtown, close to everything, which is why I picked the this hotel in the first place. Like in most older hotels the bathroom is small so I struggled to make space for all my makeup and stuff. Oh, it's reasonably priced.....at least by Seattle standards.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ADripps
Reviews.Content: Excellent, as always. Quiet, clean, comfortable. Definitely stay here again when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ShellyLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and we loved it. The location was perfect because we could walk to everything, take the train or the monorail, it was fantastic! The concierge was able to make reservations for use and get a fantastic table for us.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Slanger2
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel with a classy feel to it. The building, furnishings and appearance all ooze class and style, as do the staff. The hotel is superbly located right in the shopping heart of seattle, with 2 shopping centres within 1-2 blocks, the monorail to the Sky Needle next door, and Pikes market place about a 5 minute walk away. The room with 2 queens was very comfortable, with very high standard furnishings and confortable beds. Our room also had 2 bathrooms - we didn't need it but would be handy for a family of 4. The room service and restaurant food is of a very good standard and value, and there was a nice bar downstairs to have a quiet beer after a days sightseeing, while my teenage son used the free in room wifi to catch up with friends. Overall, I would not stay anywhere else when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MamaDep
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, but charming. It is like going to your grandmother's place...everything is in order, clean, but old. If you don't mind that, then this hotel can't be beat. We had room with double beds, and it was quite spacious for a downtown hotel location. The bathroom is small, but typical. No individual toiletries, but they were provided through bulk dispenser attached as fixtures, which we actually prefer. Our room faced the street, which was noisy during the day, but quieter at night. (at least we didn't notice it) If you plan to sleep in, you may not want to get a street facing room. The location is really convenient. We walked to Pike's Place with young kids and it was a nice walk...less than 10 minutes, even despite the occassional drizzle and wind. Macy's was across the street and Nordstorm was half a block away. What we really appreciated most was the hotel had a entry into the mall, which has access to the metro rail, a 4 minute ride to the Science Centre area. The hotel did not have a driveway area so you are basically unloading off the main and busy street. Valet parking was included in our room and that helped a lot. We called the hotel directly to make reservations and they waived the parking fee. Free appetizers provided in the late afternoon. The service was outstanding! The concierge was closed, so I asked the front desk clerk for information. She even went out of her way to call the restaurant and wrote down all the directions for me.

Reviews.Title: “great location, super clean, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smileymart
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Hotel is in a great location. We walked everywhere, up to the Paramount theater, down to Pike's Place. Light rail is 1 block away to airport. Bus is 1 block away and free for downtown. Staff was always very friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the Andaluca restaurant was very good. Street noice is a little loud but it is a downtown hotel. I'm a light sleeper but I didn't find it too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: family4togo
Reviews.Content: What a perfect night away! The location is great for shopping and dining in the center of the city. The rooms were cozy and comfortable, and the little touches made it a wonderful night. We had an excellent breakfast as well. Hope to make this a yearly get away with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: samsmom2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the deluxe queen and was surprised at how much living space was included. I had a wetbar area with countertop and storage space underneath for nonperishables, mini fridge and even a small sink. Only thing missing was a microwave which would have been a bonus! My queen bed was extra comfy and I was happy that an extra blanket was included in the closet. The closet was small but I didn't bring much - don't think a couple would have enough clothing space especially since drawer space was limited. Counter space in the bathroom was also limited but I was able to make do with what I had. They installed apple TV (which is a new offering) for me but with the internet connection being sketchy, it never did work for me. Overall, I was happy with my room and I couldn't ask for a better location and the price was RIGHT! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is still alive and practiced well at the Mayflower!”
Reviews.Author: Hoult
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect hotel for a mother and daughter weekend. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelfan010
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room with many amenities. We were there for the Mariners and Sounders games. Short walk to link station to ride to Stadium: $3.50 round trip. When we got back late and didn't want to order a full room service meal, it was only a short walk to a late night grocer for snacks. Right next to Westlake mall and great shopping. King suite was quiet and comfortable with plenty of room. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. $20 per night Valet parking. Pull in front of Olive Way entrance. Takes about 10-15 minutes for car retrieval. Only picky thing...I'm tall so I have to tip the shower head up in some older hotels. The towel rack is in the shower and I wasn't paying attention enough to realize I was getting the other towels wet from the shower spray so I suggest moving the towels out if you are tall.

Reviews.Title: “They comped us a suite and goodies and the serivce was excellent all around!!”
Reviews.Author: poppy23Seattle
Reviews.Content: I wrote to the Mayflower to tell them I was returning after not being there for some time. We had wtinessed something in the area that was really tragic and hadn't been back since. It was no fault of the hotel what had happened. When we arrived we found they had put us in a beautiful suite and written a nice letter. They had also put some yummy treats in the room which my 2 17 yr olds loved.The service was excellent-they let us keep our car and bags there the next day until 6 pm while we went to the market. We will definately be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.”
Reviews.Author: MidnightShow
Reviews.Content: I am a regular with hotels, as my business requires me to travel frequently. I booked this hotel for a one night stay in order to photograph Seattle. I try to review various hotels, especially if the experience is significant. The Mayflower Park was a massive disappointment in -Appearance -Accommodation -Most importantly, customer service. Check-in was average; however I noticed that in the "business center" (standing kiosks only) we could see guests conducting their business at computer stations. The room was shabby at best, and about the size of a closet. We walked in and noticed that the room was dingy, small, and had only one bed. I am disabled; room size is easy to overlook, if the room is presented acceptably and I can get around. We requested a second bed: No can do. We requested audience with a manager and let him know very clearly we were not happy. He was accusatory and combative, but kindly offered a roll-away bed. We finally conceded, and the manager continued to be combative. After that was over, we decided to see the city. Apparently the hotel was connected to access for various methods of transportation. Not for us; we were sent outside and around the building as the result of an event happening at the hotel. Again, I'm disabled which is unfortunately clearly visible. Regardless, we were sent outside in slick rain on concrete, with no assistance offered by doormen. I had to grapple down wet cement stairs and into rain. After clearing yet another flight of stairs, we made it to our transportation. Upon our return to the hotel, we called to request a roll away.
